program: Master of Public Policy (MPP) — Sanford School of Public Policy

sections.text: The MPP trains policy professionals to analyze, design, and implement evidence-based solutions to public problems in domestic and global contexts.

items: Core in economics, statistics, policy analysis, and ethics
Internship between years one and two
sections.text: Students complete a rigorous core, select policy electives, and gain real-world experience via internships and client-based projects.

items: Completion of core, specialization, and experiential components
Bachelor’s degree and application materials per Sanford policy
sections.text: Degree completion requires core and elective credits with practicum/internship; admissions review is holistic.
Graduates work in government, NGOs, multilaterals, consulting, and private sector policy roles.
